summary: The document is a historical record detailing David Reed Fromer's affiliations, residences, and activities from 1959 to 1966, including his association with student rights organizations, attendance at events under the auspices of the American Russian Institute and the Continuations Committee of World Congress and General Disarmament & Peace, and his legal battle against the draft board as a conscientious objector. It is related to the JFK assassination system and was reviewed and released with deletions, indicating some information was withheld or redacted.
key_findings: David Reed Fromer was associated with SLATE, a student rights organization at the University of California, Berkeley.
He attended events organized by the American Russian Institute and the Continuations Committee of World Congress and General Disarmament & Peace.
Fromer was reported as a conscientious objector who won a federal court stay in his battle against the draft board in 1966.
The document was reviewed and released with deletions, indicating some information was withheld or redacted.
keywords: Continuations Committee of World Congress and General Disarmament & Peace
